Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by: Rev. Joshua Cox, Church of the First Born, 22601 Merrick Blvd, Laurelton, NY 11413.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Comrie.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by: Rev. Joshua Cox, Church of the First Born, 22601 Merrick Blvd, Laurelton, N.Y.. 11413.



Council Member Comrie moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of January 23 and February 6, 2013 be adopted as printed by Council Member Fidler.
Items.MinutesNote: At this point, Council Member Gentile moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meetings of January 23, 2013 and February 6, 2013 be adopted as printed.

Items.Title: Messages & Papers from the Mayor
Communications from City, County & Borough Offices

Communication from the Office of Management & Budget - Transfer City funds between various agencies in Fiscal Year 2013 to implement changes to the City's expense budget, pursuant to Section 107(b) of the New York City Charter. (MN-2)
Items.ActionText: This Communication was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Transfer City funds between various agencies in FY'13 to implement changes to the City's expense budget. (MN-2)

Items.MatterName: Approval to increase the budget stabilization account by $961 million. (MN-3)

Items.Title: Communication from the Board of Elections - Submitting the Certification of Election of Donovan Richards as the new Council Member of the 31st  Councilmanic District, Queens County.
Items.ActionName: Rcvd, Ord, Prnt, Fld by Council
Items.ActionText: This Communication was Rcvd, Ord, Prnt, Fld by Council
Items.MatterName: Submitting the Certification of Election of Donovan Richards as the new Council Member of the 31st  Councilmanic District, Queens County.

Items.Title:
Communication from the Office of the City Clerk – Submitting the Certificate of the swearing in of Donovan Richards, as the new Council Member of the 31st Council District, Queens County.

THE CITY CLERK AND CLERK OF THE COUNCIL PERFORMS THE FORMAL CEREMONY OF THE ELECTED COUNCIL MEMBER DONOVAN RICHARDS TAKING HIS OATH OF OFFICE
Items.ActionName: Rcvd, Ord, Prnt, Fld by Council
Items.ActionText: This Communication was Rcvd, Ord, Prnt, Fld by Council
Items.MatterName: Certificate of the swearing in of Donovan Richards, as the new Council Member of the 31st Council District, Queens.

Items.MatterName: Prohibiting discrimination based on an individual’s unemployment.

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor - Mayors veto and disapproval message of Introductory Number 814-A, in relation to prohibiting discrimination based on an individual’s unemployment.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Mayor's Message be Filed, by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Mayor's Veto - Int. No. 814-A, Prohibiting discrimination based on an individual’s unemployment.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon New York State Senate to pass legislation to raise the minimum wage to $9 per hour and index future automatic increases to inflation.
Items.AgendaNote: Preconsidered - Adopted by the Committee on Civil Service and Labor
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, The President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) called for a voice vote.  Hearing those in favor, the President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) declared the Resolution to be adopted.



The following Council Member formally voted against this item: Council Member Ignizio.



Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: NYS Senate to pass legislation to raise the minimum wage to $9 per hour and index future automatic increases to inflation.

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Finance

A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to amending the district plan of the Myrtle Avenue business improvement district to authorize additional services and modify existing services for the district.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Myrtle Avenue BID

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to amending the district plan of the Hub Third Avenue business improvement district to add services and capital improvements and modify existing services in the district, to change the method of assessment upon which the district charge is based and to increase the maximum total amount to be expended for improvements in the district.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Hub Third Avenue BID

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS
Resolution calling upon New York State Senate to pass legislation to raise the minimum wage to $9 per hour and index future automatic increases to inflation.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil Service and Labor
Items.MatterName: NYS Senate to pass legislation to raise the minimum wage to $9 per hour and index future automatic increases to inflation.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, the New York State Development, Relief and Education for Alien Minors (DREAM) Act of 2013 (S.2378/A.2597).
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Immigration
Items.MatterName: NYS Development, Relief and Education for Alien Minors (DREAM) Act of 2013 (S.2378/A.2597)

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to issuing all New York City Community Board Chairs an official New York City parking placard.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Issuing all NYC Community Board Chairs an official NYC parking placard.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to recognizing certain military service as qualifying as experience in a trade.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Veterans
Items.MatterName: Recognizing certain military service as qualifying as experience in a trade.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to publishing guides to inform businesses of the rules and regulations governing the operation of certain businesses.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Small Business
Items.MatterName: Publishing guides to inform businesses of the rules and regulations governing the operation of certain businesses.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State legislature to pass A.6116/S.3011, which would amend the New York State limited liability company law to create a new business entity known as a low-profit, limited liability company.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: NYS limited liability company law to create a new business entity known as a low-profit, limited liability company. (A.6116/S.3011)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign into law legislation that would extend the deadline for voters to register for a political party and be able to vote in the 2013 primary election for that party.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Extend the deadline for voters to register for a political party and be able to vote in the 2013 primary election for that party.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the City of New York, in relation to prohibited acts committed during a local state of emergency and to certain technical revisions to chapter 1 of title 10 of such code.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Prohibited acts committed during a local state of emergency and to certain technical revisions to chapter 1 of title 10 of such code.

Items.Title: Resolution approving the new designation and changes in the designation of certain organizations to receive funding in the Expense Budget.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Approving the new designation and changes in the designation of certain organizations to receive funding in the Expense Budget.

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to waiver of fees for businesses recovering from damage caused by Hurricane Sandy.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Small Business
Items.MatterName: Waiver of fees for businesses recovering from damage caused by Hurricane Sandy.

Items.Title: Resolution urging the United States Congress to pass and the President to sign the Campus Sexual Violence Elimination Act, also known as the Campus SaVE Act, which would help to protect students from sexual violence.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Higher Education
Items.MatterName: Campus Sexual Violence Elimination Act, also known as the Campus SaVE Act.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to banning the sale of awls to persons under twenty-one years of age, open displays of awls by sellers, and possession of awls in a public place by persons under twenty-one years of age, or on school premises by persons under twenty-two years of age.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Banning the sale of awls to persons under twenty-one years of age.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Metropolitan Transit Authority to institute a “Wall of Shame” for sexual offenders.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: MTA to institute a “Wall of Shame” for sexual offenders.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, legislation authorizing New York City to install and operate red light cameras at more than 150 intersections.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Authorizing NYC to install and operate red light cameras at more than 150 intersections.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to recognizing certain equivalent military service as qualifying as experience in a trade.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Veterans
Items.MatterName: Recognizing certain equivalent military service as qualifying as experience in a trade.

Items.MinutesNote: The presence of a quorum was announced by The President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera).

The presence of a quorum was announced by The President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera).

During the Communications from City County and Borough Offices segment, Donovan Richards, certified winner of the February 19, 2013 Special Election held in the 31st Council District in Queens, was sworn-in as Council Member in a ceremony performed by the City Clerk and Clerk of the Council (Mr. McSweeney).

Items.Title: Application no.  20135318 HHR by New York City Health and Hospitals Corporation pursuant to §7385(6) of its Enabling Act requesting approval to lease a parcel of land to Meals on Wheels of Staten Island, Inc., on a portion of the Sea View Hospital Rehabilitation Center and Home campus located at 460 Brielle Avenue, Borough of Staten Island, Community Board 2, Council District 50.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Application be Approved, by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Landmarks, 460 Brielle Ave, Staten Island (20135318 HHR)

Items.Title: Application no. 20135320 PNK, pursuant to § 1301 (2) (f) of the New York City Charter concerning the proposed amendment to a maritime lease between the New York City Department of Small Business Services and Sea Travelers Realty, Inc. d/b/a Sea Travelers Marina for certain City-owned upland area and lands underwater located at 2875 Flatbush Avenue (Block 8591, parts of Lot 125 and 175), Borough of Brooklyn, Community Board 18, Council District 46.

Items.MinutesNote: At this point the Speaker (Council Member Quinn) made the following annoucements:

Whereupon on motion of the Speaker (Council Member Quinn), the President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) adjourned to meet again on Wednesday, March 20, 2013.



MICHAEL M. McSWEENEY, City Clerk

Items.MatterName: Transfer City funds between various agencies in FY'13 to implement changes to the City's expense budget. (MN-2)

Items.Title: Communication from the Office of Management & Budget – Approval to increase the budget stabilization account by $961 million, pursuant to Section 107(e) of the New York City Charter (MN-3)
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Communication be Approved, by Council approved by Roll Call.

Items.MinutesNote: The President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera)  put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such reports, which were decided in the affirmative by the following vote:

The following files were removed from the General Order Calendar and voted separately:



M-1059 & Res No. 1678 (MN-2), 44-3-0 (Negative: Halloran, Ignizio, and Oddo);
M-1060 & Res No. 1679 (MN-3), 44-3-0 (Negative: Halloran, Ignizio, and Oddo)

LU No. 773 & Res No. 1685 (Negative: Barron)

Int No. 814-A (Negative: Haloran, Ignizio, Vallone, Jr., and Oddo) (Override Item)

See files for individual votes.

Before the General Order vote, The President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) announced that In regard to the vote on Int No. 814-A and 978-A, the question before the Council is "Shall these proposed local laws be re-passed, the objections of the Mayor nonwithstanding"?:

Int Nos. 814-A and 978-A, were re-passed by the Council, notwithstanding the objections of the Mayor, by the override votes of 43-4-0 for Int No. 814-A and 47-0-0 for Int No. 978-A.   With the override of the Mayor's vetoes, these two items were thereby enacted into law by the Council.

Items.Title: Passed The Consent Agenda
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that these files be approved by consent vote.
